answers.answer: Hi.  Try eating a bedtime snack containing protein and fat,  and minimal carbs.  Boiled eggs and cheese, some nuts,  meat and salad.Come back and let us know how this works.You may also try a walk before bedtime.

We have a lot of great snack ideas in the Sugar Sense app, as well, check these out:http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/articles/Different-Snacks-for-Different-Times/2286http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/slideshows/Diabetes-Friendly-Snacks/187/1http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/slideshows/Diabetes-Friendly-Snacks/187/1http://www.medhelp.org/nutrition/articles/Smart-Snack-Swaps-for-Diabetes/2522http://www.medhelp.org/nutrition/articles/4-Filling-100-Calorie-Snacks/2435

Here is also some info on the dawn phenomenon, boosted numbers in the a.m. It may offer some other helpful suggestions besides Sally's:http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/articles/Whats-the-Dawn-Phenomenon/1728

Try drinking apple cider vinegar with mother mixed with waters. It has done wonders for me, I got the meds the same night as I started drinking it, and happy to say, haven't had to open the bottle yet!

question: My fasting numbers this week have been just over 95.  96 and 98.  Any suggestions on night time snacks  to help lower my fasting numbers.   I really do not want to be put on meds and that's the only test im having trouble with.
title: Help/suggestions
